fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40024].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the Confluence indexer attempts to index an attachment that for one reason or another cannot be indexed a multitude of bad things can happen (bad Confluence performance, indexing task never finishing, etc). The only way to prevent this is to disable the indexing of attachments by following the instructions at [How to disable indexing of attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+disable+indexing+of+attachments] and then rebuilding the indexes from scratch.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the indexer a little smarter, and if it encounters an attachment that will not index multiple times (3-5?) then quarantine the attachment to prevent the index from trying to read it. This will allow other attachments to be indexed. Additionally it might be helpful for a list of quarantined attachments.
fields.summary: Attachments in Confluence that fail indexing X times should be skipped and quarantined
Provide ability for user/admin to specify the number of "All Updates" listed in Confluence Dashboard.
Generate a report which list users in the user profile macro that exist in any page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40016].
  {panel}

I use Confluence every day and I am a big fan of wikis.  I do a lot of design and technical thinking when I am using Confluence and the space is too cluttered distracting.  It suffers form the key hole problem and provides information overload. 

Whenever I am editing a page I am surrounded with borders, banners, buttons and other useless crap that gets in the way of what I want to do. I understand you have a "terms of service" that requires that HUGE "Powered by Atlassian" banner at the bottom, and you think it is *cool* (or something ) to have huge top banners, and big empty blue button bars and whatever else your designers want for theme or "image."  But please consider the people using your software and find a way to reduce the noise and provide a clean, minimal interface for people who are stuck using your app.

You are going to get me to evangelize your product more if it suits my needs that you will be blasting "Powered by Atlassian" in my face all the time.  In fact, that banner does more harm than good for me.

Thanks,
-Andrew
fields.summary: Confluence Keyhole Problem
Provide a cancel button for space and site backup

Creating two pages with same name in 2 two different sub-directory is giving error as follows:

 !image-2015-11-23-15-33-04-539.png|thumbnail! 

MySpace->MyFolder1->GeneralInfo
MySpace->MyFolder2->GeneralInfo

To workaround this problem I moved the contents of 'GeneralInfo's into MyFolder1/2 as paragraphs.

Is there any other solution?
Or are you planning to solve such problems?
fields.summary: Can't Create 2 Pages with Same Name in Different Directory Paths in a Single Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40012].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Quartz is unable to recover from commit error (any - either transaction deadlock or WSREP cluster state failure) like this:
{noformat}
2015-11-13 06:33:12,988 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-1] [org.quartz.core.ErrorLogger] schedulerError Unable to notify JobListener(s) of Job to be executed: (Job will NOT be executed!). trigger= DEFAULT.IndexQueu
eFlusher job= DEFAULT.IndexQueueFlusher
org.quartz.SchedulerException: JobListener 'ScheduledJobListener' threw exception: Could not commit Hibernate transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransactionException: Commit failed with SQL e
xception: [See nested exception: org.springframework.transaction.TransactionSystemException: Could not commit Hibernate transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransactionException: Commit failed
with SQL exception: ]
at org.quartz.core.QuartzScheduler.notifyJobListenersToBeExecuted(QuartzScheduler.java:1951)
at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.notifyListenersBeginning(JobRunShell.java:364)
at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:190)
at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.lambda$runInThread$46(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:19)
at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool$$Lambda$98/1862956413.run(Unknown Source)
at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: org.springframework.transaction.TransactionSystemException: Could not commit Hibernate transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransactionException: Commit failed with SQL exception:
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(HibernateTransactionManager.java:514)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.processCommit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:732)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:701)
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor55.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:198)
at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy13.commit(Unknown Source)
at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.commitTransactionAfterReturning(TransactionAspectSupport.java:321)
at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:116)
at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy114.jobToBeExecuted(Unknown Source)
at org.quartz.core.QuartzScheduler.notifyJobListenersToBeExecuted(QuartzScheduler.java:1949)
... 5 more
{noformat}

After being 'unable to notify job listeners' it stops scheduling DEFAULT.IndexQueueFlusher task completely.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good if it will be possible to set up the scheduler to restart automatically or manually restart the job from Scheduled Jobs page.
h3. Workaround
Flush the index queue manually.
fields.summary: Automatic recovery of Quartz scheduler after commit error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39988].
  {panel}

If you create a table with some words with accent, Confluence will ignore them while sorting the table.

It's happening with non ascii words, such as Brazilian or French.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create one table with 7 rows with the following values:
{panel}
* Malencontreux
* Misérable
* Mouton
* Mêlé
* Savate
* Soutinen
* Sécurité
{panel}
# Create another table with the same values but without accent:
{panel}
* Malencontreux
* Miserable
* Mouton
* Mele
* Savate
* Soutinen
* Securite
{panel}
# Sort the tables to see the difference.

*Expected Behaviour:*
Confluence will ignore the accent and sort the words correctly.

*Current Behaviour:*
Confluence doesn't sort correctly accented words.
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't sort accented characters in a table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39987].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In recent versions of Confluence, it is not possible to disable only notification for attachment removal because the system sees this action as page edit and send a notification
h3. Suggested Solution
Create a separate module for notifications about attachment removal which consider it like attachment removal but not as page edit.
h3. Workaround
It is possible to disable _page-edited-notification_ but the user will not be notified on any other changes on the page.
fields.summary: Possibility to disable notifications for attachment removal
Confluence Local Administrator Should Not Be Counted Towards The License

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39982].
  {panel}

STR:

- Create a page titled 'Test Page', insert the page properties report macro. Change the label to 'Test'
- Create a child page named Test 1 - add a label 'Test'
- Add the page properties macro. Inside the macro insert a 2x2 table with the Columns 'Title' and 'Date'. Put '1' in as the title and //16-Nov-2015 as the date (using the date macro)
- Copy this page changing the page title to 'Test2'-'Test5' and change the date (I used, 4-Nov-15, 7-Apr-2016, 17-Dec-2014 and 18-Nov-15)
- View the parent page 'Test Page' to see the report, click on the date column to sort by date.

Result - the date sorts by the first number of the date not in chronological order, i.e. it will sort 16-Nov-2015, then 17-Dec-2014, then 18-Nov-2015.
fields.summary: Page properties report macro sort by date does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39981].
  {panel}


We insert the external image. (ex. https://www.ricksoft.jp/document/plugins/servlet/rw-resources/blogs/ENBLOG/logo/LOGO_BLOG_g.png).
If the image URL which starts "//" is configured as image URL , Confluence's protocol (http) is added to the URL internally although the actual image's protocol is https. 

*How to reproduce*
* We'll insert the external image (https://www.ricksoft.jp/document/plugins/servlet/rw-resources/blogs/ENBLOG/logo/LOGO_BLOG_g.png)
* Our confluence site is http://-----.

# Create a page and click +Insert >> Files and Images.
# Select "Images from the web"
# Insert the image URL "//www.ricksoft.jp/document/plugins/servlet/rw-resources/blogs/ENBLOG/logo/LOGO_BLOG_g.png" without protocol.
# Save the page

We can confirm that Confluence protocol(http) is added internally as shown in the storage format, the image URL is  http - .

 !external.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected behavior*
If the image URL without protocol is inserted, the image source's protocol should be added.
fields.summary: When inserting external image URL which starts "//" , Confluence's protocol is added internally.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39978].
  {panel}

When using the Chrome Web browser, If I open a page with a gliffy diagram on it, the page throws a "ah snap" error screen.  This does not happen with FireFox or IE browsers.  This does not happen if the page has no diagram on it.

This is a very important error to us, as many of our pages have diagrams on them.

Confluence:  5.8.14
Chrome: 46.0.2490.86
Gliffy: 6.7.1
fields.summary: When using Chrome browser, Confluence throws an "Ah Snap" error on any page with a Gliffy diagram.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39976].
  {panel}

  h3. Summary
When a page contains a page include macro in Confluence, even if it is just nested one level deep the page fill fail to render and load indefinitely. CPU usage also goes up to 100%

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001
* MySQL 5.6

Tested on PostgreSQL 9.2 and could not replicate this issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one page with simple text
# Create a second page which includes the previous page

OR

# Download and restore the space export attached to this ticket
# Try to access the 'Include one deep' page

h3. Expected Results
Page loads normally with the included text from the other page

h3. Actual Results
I don't see any exceptions in the logs, but there are multiple blocking HTTP threads (one per page load) and CPU usage is ~100%

h3. Notes
Although this is just an error caused by the page include macro, the CPU usage could cause a outages in production environments.

h3.Workaround
Copy the text from included pages directly and disable the page include macro.
fields.summary: Page include macro fails to render and page load hangs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39975].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attachments of child pages are missing if parent page was moved cross-space. Affects 5.8.16 and 5.8.17.  Upgrade to 5.8.18 if you are experiencing this issue and resolve the currently affected attachments using [these instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+resolve+missing+attachments+in+Confluence].

h3. Please do not confuse with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36497 when attachments are missing in case if move failed.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
* Create empty page (this is the parent page)
* Create empty child page of the parent page
* Attach a file to child page. Click on file and see download prompt.
* Move the parent page to another space
* Navigate to child page, and attempt to download the attachment


h3. Expected Results
Attachments are moved

h3. Actual Results
"Attachment File Not Found"
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-18 at 5.34.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

{code}2015-11-18 11:36:00.092389500 2015-11-18 11:36:00,087 WARN [http-bio-1990-exec-83] [atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager] getAttachmentData Could not find data for attachment: Attachment: Version17LaunchDRAFT.pptx v.1 (1769495) username - com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.filesystem.AttachmentDataFileSystemException: No such file for Attachment: Version17LaunchDRAFT.pptx v.1 (1769495) username. Were looking at /data/jirastudio/confluence/home/attachments/ver003/203/69/819203/233/19/1769483/1769495/1
{code}

h3. Server workaround
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+resolve+missing+attachments+in+Confluence

h3. Cloud Workaround
# Download the plugin [here|https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/download/attachments/1331462159/confluence-attachment-recovery-1.3-SNAPSHOT.jar?api=v2]
# Place the .jar in {{/data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd/}}
# If psd folder doesn't exists {{mkdir /data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd}}
# Change permissions:
{code}
chmod a+rwx /data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd/confluence-attachment-recovery-1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar
{code}
# {{nano /data/icebat/local.yaml}}
{code}
confluence::psd:
    confluence.confluence-attachment-recovery:
        target: "/data/jirastudio/confluence/service/psd/confluence-attachment-recovery-1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar"
{code}
# Run {{/sw/ondemand/install/icebatstrap/install/install-studio.sh -s}} (*no downtime is required*)
# Add *ALL* to logging {{com.atlassian.confluence.support}} and {{com.atlassian.confluence.support.upgradetask}} at https://<hosted URL>/wiki/admin/viewlog4j.action
# Go to Missing Attachment Recovery page - https://<hosted URL>/wiki/admin/plugins/attachmentrecovery/run-attachments-recovery-task.action





h3. Dev Info. 
* Full diff between OD-46 and OD-47 https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/pull-requests?create&targetBranch=refs%2Ftags%2F5.9.1-OD-2015.46.0-0446&sourceBranch=refs%2Ftags%2F5.9.1-OD-2015.47.1-0002&targetRepoId=44
* Dev doco: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CBF/CONF-39975+-+Attachment+is+broken+after+moving+page
fields.summary: Attachments on a page are broken after moving page trees between spaces
Manage users who follow a whole blog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Links to Anchors doesn't work if the space is using Documentation Theme 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
* Create a space and set its theme to Documentation Theme 
* Create a page, add an anchor and a link to this anchor
* Click on the link, the URL of the page is updated however the page doesn't roll to the point where the anchor was added

h3. Expected Results
The page is redirected to the point where the anchor was added. 

h3. Actual Results
The pages keeps on the same point of the link

h3.Workaround
# Right clicking on a link and opening in a new window will place you in the correct area of the page. 
# A better solution would be to [switch to the default global look and feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/switch-to-the-default-theme-762877014.html] for confluence, as the [Documentation theme is being discontinued|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/07/13/Announcement%3A+Some+Confluence+features+are+going+away]
# To make use of [_Table of Content Zone Macro_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] instead of _Table of Contents Macro_.
fields.summary: Links to Anchors doesn't work if the space is using Documentation Theme
As Confluence Admin I would like to configure default Email Settings for users
Confluence JIRA: How to change my email adress

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39960].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Table of Contents macro links do not redirect to the appropriate heading on the page when the Documentation theme is used in the space. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version 5.9.1-OD-2015.47.1-0002
* Space uses *Documentation Theme* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space and apply the [Documentation Theme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/the-documentation-theme-724764776.html]
# Create a new page with several headings, add the *Table of Contents* macro
# Save the page, and attempt to click on one of the heading links in the table of contents

h3. Expected Results
# You are re-directed to the appropriate heading on the page

h3. Actual Results
# You are not re-directed
 
h3.Workaround
# Right clicking on a link and opening in a new window will place you in the correct area of the page. 
# A better solution would be to [switch to the default global look and feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/switch-to-the-default-theme-762877014.html] for confluence, as the [Documentation theme is being discontinued|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/07/13/Announcement%3A+Some+Confluence+features+are+going+away]
# To make use of [_Table of Content Zone Macro_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] instead of _Table of Contents Macro_.
#* When using the ToC Zone macro, ensure all content is placed in the body of the macro. The Table of contents is generated based on headings inside the macro body.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro links do not work when using Documentation theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39958].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
This problem deals with creating new anchors in Confluence Cloud. When anchors are created using the Table of Contents Macro in Confluence Cloud, it has been observed that some links update the URL in the browser navigator but do not navigate to those links.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. Environment:
- Google Chrome Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit)
- Firefox 42.0
- Safari Version 9.0 (10601.1.56.2)

# Using Document Theme
# Create anchors in Confluence using the Table of Contents Macro
# Select any of the links

h3. Expected Results
It should navigate to the expected link.

h3. Actual Results
The links do not work.
 
h3. Notes
Nothing is thrown in the logs or the browser console.
Only affects Document Theme. Global Look and Feel doesn't have this problem.

h3.Workaround
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25 Nov 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
As covered in: [This Comment Below | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39958?focusedCommentId=832859&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-832859]
Dear All,

Thanks for taking the time to raise and comment on this issue. Unfortunately the Documentation Theme will be discontinued in Confluence v6.0. So we have decided to close this as won't fix
More information could be found at: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/07/13/Announcement%3A+Some+Confluence+features+are+going+away

Regards
Minh Tran
Confluence Bugmaster
Atlassian
{panel}

After you click on the anchored link, the URL in the browser will update but nothing will happen. Click on the URL in the browser navigator and click Enter. That will take you to the desired page.

OR

Windows - Right Click, or MAC Control+Click, on the link and select open in new tab

OR

Update theme to Global Look and Feel

OR

Use of [_Table of Content Zone Macro_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] instead of _Table of Contents Macro_.
fields.summary: Conf Cloud Anchors made by Table of Contents macro don't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39924].
  {panel}

On the attachments screen ([^file-attachments-screen.png]) , and on the attachment macro ([^attachment-macro.png]), clicking the attachment link in certain versions of IE (9,11) prompts the user with a dialog to Open, Save, or Save As the file. 

This can be confusing to users that are accustomed to the "Edit in Office" functionality, especially if they're not aware of the actual link for editing in Office. And so clicking the link will open the file in read-only mode, but in order to edit the file the Office application will prompt the user to enable editing, and once the user does so it will attempt to fetch the file from the Confluence server but _without proper credentials_, which results in the Office application reloading with the contents of the Confluence log in screen. 

Creating a separate "Download" link (for the attachments screen) or button (for the attachments macro) and grouping it with the other links or buttons may be better for usability.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add an Office document to a Confluence page
# On the page, go to Tools > Attachments
# With IE11, click the attachment link and click Open on the resulting dialog
# Enable editing in the Office application
fields.summary: Unlink attachment links and add a download link/button instead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39921].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In 'Product Requirement' pages in Confluence with Epic links, if we navigate to a different page and then back to the page, we get this error in the JIRA issue macros:
{panel}
Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. Precondition Failed
{panel}

When using back/forward button on a browser, it can miss loading the JIRA issue on a page and will also get the same error.

h3. Environment
Only tested in Chrome and using JIRA and Confluence Cloud.
JIRA version: 7.0.0-OD-08-005, 7.1.0-OD-03-049

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JIRA+Confluence Cloud instance
# Create 2 projects in JIRA
# In one, create an Epic
# Create a "Product Requirement" and add that Epic in the Epic row in the column
# Add some other JIRA Issue macro to another issue
# Go to the Confluence page
# Navigate to some other page in the same tab (so there's an option to go back to the previous page)
# Go back to the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
The Confluence page is displayed as before

h3. Actual Results
The second time the page is accessed, this error is shown in the issue macros:
{noformat}
Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. Precondition Failed
{noformat}
This error is visible in the browser console:
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientId/50c07907-2dc4-4c08-885c-f19b101eb484 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 412 (Precondition Failed)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Simply refresh the page and the macro will be fixed.
fields.summary: "Precondition Failed" error when redirected to Confluence page with Epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39920].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence admin, I would like the Livesearch Macro's autocomplete to suggest results after a couple of letters and not after typing the first word of my search.

h5. Example:
# Create a test space named *TEST*
# Create a parent root page called *Contacts*
# Create various sub-pages under the *Contacts* page with names 
** *UserA Test, UserB Test, UserC Test* and add a label named contactlabel
# Add a *Livesearch* macro to the root page Contacts
# Use the *Restrict to this Space Key* property to restrict it to the current space
# Use the *Restrict to label(s)* property to restrict it to the contactlabel label.
# Go to the *Contacts* page and search for *UserA Test*
# Notice the suggestion only comes up after typing the compete first word UserA. This can be misleading as end user's believe there are no results when typing only the first couple of letters (e.g. Use)


h3. Suggested Solution
 Suggested results may be displayed after typing the first few letters of the search term and not the first complete word.

h3. Workaround 
None so far
fields.summary: As a Confluence admin, I would like the Livesearch Macro's autocomplete to suggest results after a couple of letters
User customizable sidebar independent of global settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39912].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Side bar does not scroll correctly when logged in as administrator on long pages

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1
* Internet Explorer 11, Google Chrome (latest), Mozilla Firefox (with smooth scrolling turned off) on Mac and PC.
* The operating system is set to jump 2 or 3 lines with page scrolling

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with [lots of content|http://generator.lorem-ipsum.info/], so that the left scroll bar appears in the browser.
# Log in as administrator
# Go to the page created in step 1
# Use the mouse wheel to scroll down three lines
# Use the mouse wheel to scroll up three lines

h3. Expected Results
The side bar moves down with the page content.

h3. Actual Results
The side bar stays at the top and blocks the menu

!bug.PNG|thumbnail! 
!chrome.png|thumbnail!
!ie11.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Occurs also with arrow keys, but not as extreme.
Doesn't occur on Chrome for Linux.

h3.Workaround
* refreshing the page

or
* pressing [ twice (it hides and un-hides the side bar)
fields.summary: Side bar does not refresh when logged in as administrator and scroll up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39908].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:

# Add  “Filter Results” Gadget in Confluence from JIRA.
# Add “Filter Results” macro to a page.
# Enter one of the letter from filter name(for example A) into the 'Saved Filter' field.

h6. Expected Behaviour:
It needs to show all the filters that contain "A".

h.6 Current Behaviour:
!1.png|width=512!

h6. Workaround:

Add a space after the letter:
!2.png|width=512!
fields.summary: Filter Result gadget doesn't show proper suggestion with typing a letter of filter name
Images in email notifications don't respect the size set in the Confluence page
Improve the Shared Links blueprint to embed cards
Allow a portion of an image to be highlighted and associated with a pin/inline comment
A macro is needed to list all comments dropped on an image
Allow a comment pin to be moved once it has been placed

[Backend] Font not found warning messages when indexing PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39892].
  {panel}

The pdf indexer throws a lot of error messages when indexing pdf files. 
{code}
ERROR [Indexer: 3] [apache.pdfbox.filter.FlateFilter] decode FlateFilter: stop reading corrupt stream due to a DataFormatException
{code}
This is probably caused by a bug in the pdfbox. 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PDFBOX-2497

The bug above is fixed in 1.8.8 although we are using 1.8.10 and still seeing the error message. it can possibly be a regression.

h3. Workaround : 
(!) Do note that this workaround is only tested in small instances and if you're facing any issues after applying this, restore back the PDFBOX version to the default bundled version and clear the plugin cache with a restart.
(!) This is only applicable if your PDFBOX version is 1.8.x.

# Download this [PDFBOX version 1.8.12 here|http://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox/1.8.12/pdfbox-1.8.12.jar]
# Shutdown Confluence
# Go to {{<Confluence Installation Directory>\confluence\WEB-INF\lib}} and search for PDFBOX 1.8.xx jar file. Remove the jar file and keep it somewhere in a non-Confluence folder.
(!) It is important not to leave two versions of the same plugin jar file in the installation directory as all of them will be deployed upon start up.
# Insert the PDFBOX 1.8.12 version here.
# Clear the plugin cache
#- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+clear+Confluence+plugins+cache
# Start Confluence

The errors will not appear again after a content index.
fields.summary: PDF extractor throws data format exception error in logs
Lock and unlock ability to add inline comments
Dropdown list macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39887].
  {panel}

I'd like to see the Confluence status macro changed in a couple of ways. 

First the status macro changes the words and the colors separately. That means that anybody who edits the page has to remember what each color means and what word should be used for each status. Further, there can be inconsistent use of colors on a single page. I want the statuses to be set up so that the page creator can predefine the color/status messages at the start.

Second I'd like to see the status color/message to be changeable without going into edit mode.

To sum it all up, perhaps the best way to implement these two suggestions is to make the word and color combinations editable from the edit mode. Then enable the user to toggle the right status from the read mode.
fields.summary: Status macro suggestion

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39880].
  {panel}

*Summary:*
User can add a code block macro within an inline comment. Once the comment is saved, the content of the code macro is not shown. (Silently missing).  When editing the inline comment again, the code macro is still shown. (so it is not lost, but not rendered when viewing the inline comment)

*Environment:*
Confluence 5.7 and above  (we are on 5.8.10)

*Steps to reproduce:*
On any confluence page, highlight some text to add an inline comment.
In the inline comment editor, type
{code macro}
and add some code.
Save the comment.

*Result:*
The inline comment shows what-ever else was written into the comment, but not the content of the code block

*Expected result:*
Correct rendering of the code
fields.summary: code block in Inline Comments are not rendered
Missing captcha image in documentation addcomment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39871].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If a JIRA Issues Macro (individual issue view) is included in the heading row or column of a table it won't load.

h3. Environment
* Confluence  5.9.1-OD-2015.45.1-0006

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence instance linked with JIRA create a Confluence page with a table in it
# In the header row insert a JIRA Issues Macro that refers to a specific issue
# In the row below that (not header) insert the same JIRA Issues Macro

h3. Expected Results

Both JIRA Issues Macros load

h3. Actual Results

The JIRA Issues Macro in the heading spins forever and never loads.

h3.Workaround

Make the row or column of the table not a heading
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro not loading in heading of table
Add option to modify Hazelcast multicast timeout in Confluence Data Center
Extend the web-section module to allow to add a custom button besides Add, Watch, Share, etc. at the top of the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39868].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
A user's overseas team may make updates during their business hours which are not included by midnight but would be included if the email were sent at 5:00 AM , for example.
h3. Suggested Solution
The 5:00 AM time may only be appropriate for specific users so it would be handy if it could be set in the user's profile rather than globally on the Scheduled Jobs page.
fields.summary: Add ability to set time for daily summary report email in individual user profiles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39866].
  {panel}

Confluence now renders TOCs differently (client-side rather than serve-side as before). This breaks customer doc which is produce by a program that reads the html that Confluence produces.

Is there a way to make the server use the old implementation ?
(a) immediately, if only be tweaking some config file
(b) a user-friendly way via the gui for the medium term
fields.summary: TOC macro on the server-side
Hide content on export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39862].
  {panel}

h2. Workaround
Work around this problem by first restoring the site backup into 5.6 ([link to the archives|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives/]), then re-create the backup. Doing this will "fix" the backup file to contain the correct set of fields, and therefore, can be restored into 5.7 or later (including cloud instances).

h2. Detailed Description
importing a site backup made from pre-5.0 (pre user-rename) into 5.7 or later fails, if there are content restrictions set. You will see an error ({{Error while importing backup: property does not exist: userName}}). 

i think caused by commits made for https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35969 , which removed the handling for old fields that have been removed/changed for user-rename.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39846].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently the only option we have to enable or disable the Membership Aggregation in Confluence is by running a REST call to disable/enable it, as described in [Managing Multiple Directories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/managing-multiple-directories-229838494.html#ManagingMultipleDirectories-NonAggregatingMembership]:
{code}
# To GET the current setting
curl -H 'Accept: application/json' -u <username> <base-url>/rest/crowd/latest/application

# To PUT the setting
curl -H 'Content-type: application/json' -X PUT -d '{"membershipAggregationEnabled":true}' -u <username> <base-url>/rest/crowd/latest/application
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Give administrators the ability to tell Confluence to use a non-aggregating membership scheme in the directory configuration UI so they don't need to use a REST call.

h3. Workaround 

Use the [API Browser plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser] to perform the call and disable it.
fields.summary: Add option to enable or disable membership aggregation in the directory configuration UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39845].
  {panel}

The mentioned confluence page feature does not work in table view form. The mentioned in question is the feature as per the screenshot below :
!mentionFeature.jpg|thumbnail!
When JIRA issue macro is added to a Confluence page this will show the mentioned page in the JIRA ticket. However in table view this functionality does not work.

Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence
# Create a new page
# Add a jira macro by typing {JIRA then pick the first in the Macro suggestions
# A pop up window as per the screenshot below should come up then start searching for the JIRA issue
!jiraIssuePopup.jpg|thumbnail!
# Search for a JIRA issue, in this case I searched for TEST-3 and the results returned
# After that, click on the Display options and change it to Table as per the screenshot below :
!tableView.jpg|thumbnail!
# Click on Insert to complete the insertion to the page and you will see something like the screenshot below :
!jiraIssueTable.jpg|thumbnail!
# Go to the JIRA issue in JIRA and you will not see the mentioned page :
!jiraIssueLink.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected result : the mentioned page should show
Current result : the mentioned page is not shown

This issue also occurs when I try it out in EAC with JAC.
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro in table view in Confluence does not link the page to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39834].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On the first login on Confluence, users are forced to start watching a space so they can go through "Welcome" screens. This is not ideal especially if users don't even know if the contents are relevant when first signing in.
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-06 at 11.27.22 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be a "Skip" button.
 
h3. Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Allow users to go through Welcome screen without having to start watching a space
Ability to make Watchers of a Space visible (Social Spaces)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39832]. {panel} h3. Summary Using _Heading_ when adding _Table of Contents_ would add a bullet point at the top of the Table of Contents. Using _Paragraph_ when adding _Table of Contents_ would display the _Table of Contents_ properly. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Created a page # Add _Table of Content_ using _Heading 1_ # Save the page h3. Expected Results * Bullet point should not be added at the top of the Table of Contents !TOC.png|thumbnail! Storage format would show: {noformat}

{noformat} h3. Actual Results * Bullet point is added at the top of the Table of Contents * !TOC1.png|thumbnail! Storage format would show: {noformat}

{noformat} h3.Workaround * Use _Paragraph_ when adding _Table of Contents_
fields.summary: Using Heading when adding Table of Contents would add a bullet point on top of the TOC
Plans to remove the view file macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39820].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When logging in as a new Confluence user, the space names are truncated with no way of viewing the end of the space name. There's no way to scroll to the end of the name to see which one you are watching.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a way to scroll to the end or perhaps mouse-over and have a Tooltip tell you the full name of the space

!Screen Shot 2015-11-05 at 17.47.28.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a new user, in Watch a Few Spaces dialogue, space names are truncated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39819].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
With recent version Confluence Data Center the only possible way to discover other cluster nodes is sending a request on UDP port of multicast address. In some environments like secured corporate networks and some cloud providers like Amazon AWS (VPC) and Google Cloud, it blocks the discovery mechanism. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the possibility to configure discovery using unicast.
h3. Workaround
No workaround available currently.
fields.summary: Using unicast for discover cluster nodes in Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39818].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In a [Recent release of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/1-november-2015-to-7-november-2015-785459990.html], there's a new feature mentioned under *Give them a list of spaces to watch*. This explains that users will have the opportunity to watch popular spaces.

This is only based on popular spaces.

h3. Suggested Solution
Administrators would like to create their own list of spaces that show up under *Watch a few spaces* that users can watch, rather than have only the popular ones show up.
fields.summary: As an admin, choose list of spaces on Watch a Few Spaces...
Create space without Confluence Admin access
Display user who able to access the space
Bump Confluence notifications version to 8.2.1
Expecting claim 'qsh' to have value ... when following email notification
bulk move blogs
Ability to add date duration for Confluence Contributors Summary Macro

fields.description:

Hi
When I try to give global permissions to an individual user by selecting edit, the box does not appear for me to add the user.

Please assist urgently.

Regards
Sal
fields.summary: Unable to give global permissions to an individual user
Enhance the Attachments page to support preview functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39793].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. mention someone in a page comment.
2. ask the person mentioned to click on the link on the @mention notification email
3. a Tomcat HTTP 401 error will be displayed
(see attachment)

The same happens for Page Share notifications

h3. Workaround
Delete the {{&jwt=<long string of letters and numbers>}} from the URL and load the page again.
fields.summary: Links to pages in notification emails failing with 401

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39789].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Administrative functions such as reindexing, flushing queue, and scheduled jobs can only be done through the UI.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a CLI for admins to user to perform these functions
fields.summary: As an admin I want a CLI to perform administrative functions such as indexing and scheduled jobs
